Abstract SOUZA, Isabella Cesario de Amaral. Utiliza√ß√£o de catalisadores de n√≠quel e platina suportados em Al2O3 e ZrO2 na reforma a vapor de √°cido ac√©tico para a produ√ß√£o de hidrog√™nio. Hydrogen is recognized as one of the major energy sources of the future and the cleanest among the current ones, especially when produced from biomass. Its production by steam reforming process of a b io-oil constitutes a positive approach, due to the low added value of the raw material. The composition of the bio -oil is extremely complex and therefore, acetic acid can be considered as a model compound due to the higher concentration in its composition. The main objective of this work was the development of bimetallic Ni and Pt catalysts, supported on Al2O3 and ZrO 2, for steam reforming of acetic acid. The application of these catalysts in the process aim s at a high hydrogen yield and a good stability over the reaction time. For this, four monometallic catalysts (15NiZr, 15NiAl,
1PtZr and 1PtAl) and four bimetallic ca talysts (1Pt15NiZr, 3Pt15NiZr, 5Pt15NiZr and
1Pt15NiAl) were prepared in order to study the influence of Pt and Ni addition on the

reaction performance. The characterization was conducted by X -ray fluorescence, X -ray diffraction, H 2 chemisorption, t emperat ure-programmed reduction of H 2, temperature programmed desorption of NH 3, thermogravimetric analysis, Raman spectroscopy, and scanning electron microscopy. All the catalysts were evaluated in temperature test from 450 ¬∫C to 750 oC, and 500 ¬∫C w as the selec ted temperature to evaluate stability for 30 hours. From the characterization, it was observed that the addition of Pt reduced the Ni crystallite size, enhancing the metallic dispersion in the bimetallic catalysts. The spillover effect was identified in th e bimetallic catalysts due to Pt addition in Ni, leading to a significant decrease in the reduction temperature of Ni. C ontrary to expectations , the addition of Pt on Ni in the bimetallic catalysts did not significantly affect the catalyst performance when compared to the monometallic catalysts. Despite the 15NiZr exhibit a larger crystallite size, it was the most active achieving 100 % conversion and the highest H2 yield (~30 %) over the reaction time. The 5Pt15NiZr and 1Pt15NiAl catalysts also presented high catalytic activity in the same conditions achieving almost 20% of H2 yield at the end of the reaction. The 1PtAl showed low activity while the 1PtZr exhibited the worst performance, with a continuous deactivation, w ith conversion of 10 % at the end of reaction. This catalyst produced more acetone, probably due to its high acidity, leading to coke production. The characterization of the produced coke showed that despite the identification of filamentous coke, the amor phous coke was predominant in the catalysts.
Key words: Acetic acid, Hydrogen, Nickel, Platinum and Steam reforming.
